chat.title: Suggestion
chat.message: Usually O negative blood given if unknown type and screen. However, if male, post reproductive age woman, or known Rh positive, I think can have O positive blood as well... would have to clarify standards and recommendations with transfusion medicine, etc. Might be simpler to always give O negative if unkown blood type, or this might already be figured out behind the scenes by transfusion / lab.
Lab section looks odd - mixed in with blood product orders it appears
